name: Traveler
title: TMN,
description: is the playable protagonist of Genshin Impact. In the opening cutscene, twin siblings from another world travel through the universe, until Asmodayblocked their path. The player gets to choose either Aether(male) or Lumine(female) as the Traveler and the Traveler's Siblingbecomes captured.

sections.Elemental Alignment: At the beginning of the game and in The Crux Clashin Chapter II: Prologue -Autumn Winds, Scarlet Leaves, the Traveler is "unaligned," a special elemental state exclusive to them. When unaligned, the color of the Traveler's "vision" and background when they are selected in the Character Menuis gray. Although the Traveler's Profile lists their Constellationproperly as Viator/Viatrix, attempting to open the Constellation tab will show a blank screen with "Constellation Unavailable" in the bottom-right corner. When unaligned, the Traveler has only one talent, Normal Attack:Past Memories. When unaligned, screens that show character cards with their elements show a gray "no" symbol (🚫︎) in the place of the element symbol. Shortly after the beginning of the game, the Traveler will unlock their Anemo Talents and Constellation by resonating with the first Statue of The Sevenin Mondstadt. They can resonate with any other Statue of The Seven they find and change their element to match the statue's element.See Teyvatfor each region's element. However, the Traveler does not immediately gain the Pyroelement upon resonating with a Statue of The Seven in Natlan, due to corrupted Ley Linesin the region. They instead unlock their abilities during Where All Hopes Liein Chapter V: Act V -Incandescent Ode of Resurrection, and are able to properly resonate with Natlan's Statues of the Seven following this quest.
sections.Availability: The Traveleris obtained at the start of the game and is not featured in any Wishes.

full_text:
# Traveler
Also known as: TMN,

## Basic Information
- Weapon: Sword
- Rarity: 5-Star
- Region: Natlan
- Model: Medium Male
- Constellation: Viator
- Character Type: Synthetic
- Affiliations: The Seven

## Character Roles
- Role: Unknown

## How to Obtain
- Wishes

## Release Date
Released on: September 28, 2020

## Voice Actors
- English: Aether
- Chinese: Aether:Luyin
- Japanese: Aether:Horie Shun
- Korean: Aether:Lee Kyeong-tae

## About
is the playable protagonist of Genshin Impact. In the opening cutscene, twin siblings from another world travel through the universe, until Asmodayblocked their path. The player gets to choose either Aether(male) or Lumine(female) as the Traveler and the Traveler's Siblingbecomes captured.

## Elemental Alignment
At the beginning of the game and in The Crux Clashin Chapter II: Prologue -Autumn Winds, Scarlet Leaves, the Traveler is "unaligned," a special elemental state exclusive to them. When unaligned, the color of the Traveler's "vision" and background when they are selected in the Character Menuis gray. Although the Traveler's Profile lists their Constellationproperly as Viator/Viatrix, attempting to open the Constellation tab will show a blank screen with "Constellation Unavailable" in the bottom-right corner. When unaligned, the Traveler has only one talent, Normal Attack:Past Memories. When unaligned, screens that show character cards with their elements show a gray "no" symbol (🚫︎) in the place of the element symbol. Shortly after the beginning of the game, the Traveler will unlock their Anemo Talents and Constellation by resonating with the first Statue of The Sevenin Mondstadt. They can resonate with any other Statue of The Seven they find and change their element to match the statue's element.See Teyvatfor each region's element. However, the Traveler does not immediately gain the Pyroelement upon resonating with a Statue of The Seven in Natlan, due to corrupted Ley Linesin the region. They instead unlock their abilities during Where All Hopes Liein Chapter V: Act V -Incandescent Ode of Resurrection, and are able to properly resonate with Natlan's Statues of the Seven following this quest.

## Availability
The Traveleris obtained at the start of the game and is not featured in any Wishes.

description: is a playable Anemo characterin Genshin Impact. He was once Scaramouche, the Sixth of the Eleven Fatui Harbingers, also known by his codename "The Balladeer." After erasing his previous identities from Irminsul, he became a drifter until he willingly regained his memories. He is currently a Driyosh of the Vahumana Darshan. # Wanderer
Also known as: The Balladeer.

## Basic Information
- Element: Anemo

- Rarity: 5-Star
- Region: Inazuma
- Model: Medium Male

- Role: On-Field / DPS

- Wishes
- Quest Reward

Released on: December 07, 2022

## Voice Actors
- English: Patrick Pedraza
- Chinese: Luyin
- Japanese: Kakihara Tetsuya
- Korean: Min Seung-woo

## Special Dish
- Shimi Chazuke

## Namecard
- Wanderer: Drifter's Ballad

## About
is a playable Anemo characterin Genshin Impact. He was once Scaramouche, the Sixth of the Eleven Fatui Harbingers, also known by his codename "The Balladeer." After erasing his previous identities from Irminsul, he became a drifter until he willingly regained his memories. He is currently a Driyosh of the Vahumana Darshan. During the Archon Quest As Though Morning Dewin Interlude Chapter: Act III -Inversion of Genesis, the player can change the Wanderer's name, which will then be used in some of the game's interfaces, such as Party Setup.

name: Wonderland Manekin
description: The Wonderland Manekin is a playable system character representing the Miliastra Wonderland gameplay mode in Genshin Impact.

sections.Ascensions and Stats: Manekin requires no Character EXP Materials,Character Ascension Materials, or Morato level up or ascend. After reaching certain Wonderland Levels in Miliastra Wonderland, Manekin can be ascended to the next ascension, automatically leveling up to the maximum level of that ascension.
sections.Talents: Manekin talents require no Character Talent Materialor Mora to level up. They are automatically raised to their highest level for the Manekin's ascension as you ascend the Manekin.
sections.Availability: Manekin is obtained from Miliastra Wonderland and is not featured in any Wishes.

Chalk pursues gold, in this time inopportune, theeclipseis swallowed by thecrimson moon. name: Illuga
description: For new members joining the Lightkeepers, few things are more fortunate than having a leader like Illuga. Though Lightkeepers witness the tragic aftermath of the Wild Hunt's rampages every day, and the atmosphere in their quarters can often grow heavy and oppressive, Illuga somehow remains positive. He not only manages all tasks efficiently but also offers careful, thoughtful support to his teammates. Walking beside him, it feels as if even the lantern in your hand glows a little warmer. Some people wonder why someone like him hasn't chosen to work in logistics, but instead insists on going to the dangerous frontlines. Without unwavering resolve and strong inner drive, even optimistic smiles will one day be drowned by the purple-black despair. Yet whenever they hear Illuga recite the Lightkeepers' oath with conviction, such doubts vanish from their hearts — undoubtedly, beneath his gentle exterior burns a fierce, blazing fire. What are the ideals and beliefs of the Lightkeepers? This is the question newcomers ask most often, and each Lightkeeper would answer differently. Yet there is always a common thread in these answers — protection and salvation, steadfastness and unwavering resolve. They speak of a bright outcome, or a noble vision, grand and magnificent beyond measure. But Illuga desires little beyond defeating the Wild Hunt, for he realizes that, in its current state,Piramidaalready embodies that ideal. Only those who have endured the nightmare can truly grasp how precious the daylight is. What he wishes to protect is simple — the present. A young and upcoming man part of the Lightkeepersas a Ratnik and is the adoptive son of Nikita, the current Starshyna.

name: Zibai
description: Among the people of Liyue, tales of the Adeptiare ever-abundant. Like the leisurelyadeptus of the cloudswho dispelled droughts with nourishing rain in the "Full Record of Pristine Pavilion," and the Golden-Winged Kingwho purged plagues and banished pestilence in "Yakshas: The Guardian Adepti." They are all beings of immense power, guardians of peace in every corner of the land, who the people hold in reverence and awe. And there was, in particular, a certain White Horse Adeptus, whose trail pervades many a book and folktale. Some say she became a steed as white as snow and, in the days of the Archon War, aided Rex Lapisin attaining supremacy over the mortal realm. Others whisper that her eyes, like amber touched with gold, hold the power to gaze through the desolate wastelands of time itself. Still others claim she has always lived on themoon, listening to the wishes of mortals, and keeping watch over the world of flickering lights below. Yet, amidst all these different accounts, none could truly capture her visage, nor paint a likeness of her form. Whether amidst gentle tea-time chatter, or in debates pouring out over ink-filled scrolls, each view was a glimpse through a keyhole — catching naught but fragments, never the full picture. In any case, she was as a shard of blessed light, a wild goose upon the snow, whose footprints vanish with the morning. Still, her yesteryears linger in the mortal dust, and her tale awaits its dawn into the world of the waking.

Some say she became a steed as white as snow and, in the days of the Archon War, aided Rex Lapisin attaining supremacy over the mortal realm. Others whisper that her eyes, like amber touched with gold, hold the power to gaze through the desolate wastelands of time itself. Still others claim she has always lived on themoon, listening to the wishes of mortals, and keeping watch over the world of flickering lights below. Yet, amidst all these different accounts, none could truly capture her visage, nor paint a likeness of her form. Whether amidst gentle tea-time chatter, or in debates pouring out over ink-filled scrolls, each view was a glimpse through a keyhole — catching naught but fragments, never the full picture. In any case, she was as a shard of blessed light, a wild goose upon the snow, whose footprints vanish with the morning. Still, her yesteryears linger in the mortal dust, and her tale awaits its dawn into the world of the waking.
